conclusion: Analyze motion based on velocity-time graph to determine when particles are farthest apart.
Particle A and B start from rest at t = 0.
Particle A starts with an initial velocity of 2v0.
Particle B starts with an initial velocity of v0.
Particle A moves with constant velocity of 2v0 for 2t0 and then with constant velocity of v0 for 4t0.
Particle A is farthest from particle B when their positions are equal at t = 2t0.
Particle B moves with constant velocity of v0 for 4t0 and then with constant velocity of 2v0 for 2t0.
Particle B is farthest from particle A when their positions are equal at t = 4t0.
Particles A and B are farthest apart at t = 2t0 and t = 4t0.
